 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קִפּוֺז‎</span> **noun feminine** ==arrow-snake== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, so [[BDB#Bo|Bo]]<sup>Hieroz. Pars post. iii. Cap. 11</sup> (citing Avicenna<sup>ii. 139, 16,</sup> compare [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 89</sup>), and most moderns; compare [[BDB#Dozy|Dozy]]<sup>ii. 383</sup> [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>1375 ad. Fin</sup>.; = <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἀκοντίας</span> Aelian<sup>Hist. Anim. Vi. 18, viii. 13</sup>, called <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ק‎</span> as ***leaping*** from trees on passers-by; but against this see Houghton<sup>Acad. Apr. 24, 1886, 292 f.</sup> (arrow-snake does not incubate) [[BDB#Post|Post]]<sup>Hast. DB iii. 637</sup> who conjectures an owl (as [[BDB#AV|AV]])); — [[Isa.34.15|Isa 34:15]], token of desolation.
